friend of Democratic congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords , has visited the lawmaker in her hospital room and is in close contact with her astronaut husband Mark Kelly, she told NBC's "Meet The Press." Gabrielle Giffords is making progress every day. She's using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand said. September 5, 2002 Report Shaffer wrote on September 5, 2002 that he had been asked by Donald Rumsfeld what the U.S. did not know in terms of percentage about Iraq's WMD program. We've struggled to estimate unknowns, and the attached briefing sumps up our best J2 sense, he said. J2 is an intelligence group supporting top level U.S. defense officials. "We range from 0% to about 75% knowledge on various aspects of their program," he said.
